Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
January 19, 1860 from Tibey Scott and Mary Scott to Dr. James H. Minor and Elizabeth Minor
Careysburg , Jan 19th, 1860 Mr James H Mior

Deare Sir I write you these lines to inform you of my health wich is quite well. I hope these lines will find you all well in health. My Best respects to Joseph Tarel William Tarel Mr Thomas Estres family Liess Harris family & Julia A Ann Haliaday & her servient & saddy in particular My children all is well Mary & Milred & Robert & Thomas Send thar best love to you all. we lik the country very well our littel town are inproven very much with amegrants at this time. Both of the Boys gos to chule we have the pleasur of goin to church three times as week. our pastur is a pastur from Richmond I re ceived the thing you sent us 3 pare of shoes , 1 keg of [hole in ms.] you have ay thing els to send me please send me some cloth for my boys such as cotton cloth to make for & any thing els you think we stand need of & some white cloth. Mr Minor fare well fare well if we never meet on erth no mor I hop to meet you in heaven whare partin will be no more
Nothing more yours Much love Tibey Scott
January 19, 1860 from Tibey Scott and Mary Scott to James H. Minor and Elizabeth Minor

I write you these lines to inform you of my health which is quite well. I hope these will find you the same I recive your letter & was very glad to hear from you. We have a very fine county I like it very well none of the Girls is married as yeat . Give My Best respects Robarte Liess family & Sarah houel tell them all howdy at the kreek you have neve write me about Richard. as yeat I do rais some fouls & some Ducks. All the peopel is well we all live in one town together I do see great eald of pleasur heare in this country.

Yours Much love Mary Scott Careysburg Jan 19th hole in ms. A. M. tell Naby & Roady & Aunt Rachel howdy for me me also Mott Mother send her love to them all tell Naby the next ship I will write her fare well if I never see you again I hop to meet you in heaven
Tibey Scott and Mary Scott to James H. Minor and Elizabeth Minor 1860 January 19
